description: Wesley Clark, former NATO Supreme Allied Commander for Europe, discusses the United States seizing a Venezuelan oil tanker and suggests this is a push to get Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out. He also talks about the Trump Administration owing the American people an explanation for the boat strikes in September, and shares his reaction to the House Armed Services ending their investigation into these same events. Wesley speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power."  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Seizing Oil Tanker Is Another Push at Maduro: Clark

description: Oracle fell more than 10% in extended trading after reporting a jump in spending on AI data centers and other equipment, rising outlays that are taking longer to translate into cloud revenue than investors want. Elsewhere, Adobe delivered an upbeat annual forecast but still drew a lukewarm reaction from investors, who have been seeking clearer signs that the software maker can thrive in an era of artificial intelligence. Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Technology Analyst Anurag Rana joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Oracle Falls on AI Capex, Adobe Gives Upbeat Outlook

description: Betsey Stevenson, University of Michigan Public Policy & Economics Professor, reacts to President Trump suggesting US GDP should be as high as 25%. She also discusses the Federal Reserve cutting rates by 25 basis points and if Fed Chair Jerome Powell is prioritizing the job market or inflation with this latest cut. She speaks with Joe Mathieu on the latest edition of Bloomberg’s “Balance of Power.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fed Trying to Balance Job Market, Inflation: Stevenson

description: US Treasuries rose after the Federal Reserve lowered interest rates by a quarter-point for a third straight meeting and left the door open to additional policy easing in 2026. Yields fell across the curve on Wednesday, sinking from multimonth highs. But the Fed-sensitive two-year note led the rally, tumbling almost 8 basis points to 3.54%, for its largest one-day slide in two months. Treasuries extended gains after Fed Chair Jerome Powell highlighted concern about weaker hiring. Bloomberg Intelligence Chief US Interest Rate Strategist Ira Jersey joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss. He speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Treasuries Gain as Fed Cuts, Traders Wager on Two More in 2026

author: Zoe Tillman
description: Almost 400 people pardoned or granted clemency by President Donald Trump in connection with the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol are now seeking millions of dollars in payouts from the federal government, according to their lawyer.
title: Trump Pardoned Them for Jan. 6. Now They Want Millions of Dollars

author: Yoshiaki Nohara, Akemi Terukina
description: China and Japan’s diplomatic spat shows no sign of an immediate offramp even as the leadership of a Japanese political party that helped break the ice in a previous dispute continues to talk with officials from Beijing behind the scenes.
title: Japan-China Spat Lacks Immediate Offramp Despite Komeito Talks

author: Amara Omeokwe
description: Projections show a divergence on outlook for next year.
title: Drama May Be New Normal for the Fed With Divide on Interest Rates

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said his administration is accepting applications for his “Gold Card” visa program starting Wednesday, touting the effort as critical to helping businesses hire foreign-born graduates of American universities.
title: US to Start Accepting ‘Gold Card’ Visa Applications, Trump Says

description: President Donald Trump says a quarter-point rate cut by the Fed is not enough. Trump called that “a rather small number that could have been doubled, at least doubled,” and criticized Powell as a “stiff” and a “dead head.” The Federal Open Market Committee voted 9-3 Wednesday to lower the benchmark federal funds rate to a range of 3.5%-3.75%.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Says Fed Should Have Cut Rates by Even More

description:
nat sound up
show ceremony, crowd, woman at podium, pic of machado
(its machado's daughter accepting the nobel)
SOURCE: Production NRK

Norway Nobel Peace Prize
10092005 (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Venezuela's Opposition leader Machado awarded Nobel Prize

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump signaled he’ll oppose a Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. deal that doesn’t include new ownership of CNN, a potential wrinkle for the bid from Netflix Inc.
title: Trump Says Warner Bros. Deal Should Include Sale of CNN

author: David Feliba
description: Argentina sold local-law dollar bonds in a move seen as a first test of a planned comeback to global credit markets as Javier Milei’s administration seeks funding to meet hefty sovereign debt payments coming due next year.
title: Argentina Stages Market Comeback With Local Dollar Bond Sale

description: American Airlines Group Inc. CEO Robert Isom says the carrier took a "substantial" hit from the recent government shutdown. But he says the airline has bounced back and he's pleased with holiday bookings. He speaks to Bloomberg's Lisa Abramowicz. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: American Air Took 'Substantial' Hit From Shutdown, CEO Says

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said the Federal Reserve should have slashed interest rates by twice as much after the central bank delivered a third consecutive cut, keeping up his pressure campaign on Chair Jerome Powell.
title: Trump Hits Fed, Says Bank Should Have Doubled Rate Cut

author: Ari Natter
description: A unit of BP Plc was the high bidder in a US auction for oil and gas drilling rights in the Gulf of Mexico, the first sale held under President Donald Trump’s second term. Energy companies offered more than $279 million in winning bids.
title: BP Is Top Winner of Trump’s First Gulf of Mexico Oil Lease Sale

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Former Bolivian President Luis Arce was arrested as part of a corruption probe just over a month after leaving office, according to local media.
title: Bolivian Ex-President Arce Held in Corruption Case, Reports Say

description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell says inflation has eased but remains “somewhat elevated” compared to the Fed’s 2% longer-run goal. He speaks after announcing a 25 point interest rate cut in Washington. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Inflation Has Eased, but Remains Elevated, Powell Says

author: Michael Hirtzer, Kristina Peterson
description: The Trump administration is launching a $700 million pilot program to help farmers more easily adopt “regenerative” practices that improve the health of soil and water.
title: Trump Sets $700 Million to Improve Soil, Water on Farms

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the latest news from DC. On today's show, KISS Singer and Songwriter Gene Simmons and Yale Budget Labs Co-Founder Martha Gimbel. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Gene Simmons On Music Royalties, AI | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/10/2025

description: Martha Gimbel, executive director of the Yale Budget Lab and former senior advisor on the White House Council of Economic Advisers, says that the Fed's choice to cut rates is 'odd' given that inflation remains sticky.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Overall State of US Economy is 'Confusing,' Says Yale Budget Lab Director

description: Musician Gene Simmons of KISS said it's 'criminal' that artists aren't paid when their music is played on AM and FM radio stations in the US and it's a particularly big problem for new musical groups. Simmons testified in support of the American Music Fairness Act in front of a Senate panel earlier in the week. He speaks to Joe Mathieu about the issue on "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: KISS Star Gene Simmons Says It's 'Criminal' Musicians Aren't Paid for Radio Play

author: Gregory Korte
description: The number of federal employees who left their jobs in 2025 will total about 317,000, according to the Office of Personnel Management, after efforts by Elon Musk and the Trump administration to reshape the government workforce.
title: Federal Workforce’s Toll After a Year of DOGE and Trump: 317,000

author: Eric Martin, Patricia Garip, Ben Bartenstein
description: US forces have intercepted and seized a sanctioned oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, according to people familiar with the matter, a move that marks a serious escalation of tensions between the two countries.
title: US Seizes Oil Tanker Off the Coast of Venezuela

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro proposed a transitional government in Venezuela with representatives from across the political spectrum.
title: Colombia Leader Calls for a Transition to Democracy in Venezuela

author: Myles Miller, Siddharth Philip
description: The US government will buy six Boeing Co. 737 jets to carry out deportation flights, expanding the administration’s efforts to ramp up the removals of people living in the country without legal status.
title: US Buys Own Boeing 737 Fleet to Speed Trump’s Deportation Push

author: Emily Birnbaum, Erik Wasson
description: Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook met with US lawmakers on Wednesday to lobby against provisions in pending children’s online safety legislation that would require app store operators to authenticate users’ ages.
title: Apple’s Cook Presses US Lawmakers Over Child Online Safety Laws

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Julian Lee
description: Ukraine carried out yet another attack on a shadow-fleet tanker linked to Russia’s oil trade as it continues to target Moscow’s vital seaborne petroleum trade.
title: Ukraine Carries Out Fresh Attack on Russia Shadow Fleet Oil Ship

author: Brendan Murray
description: US President Donald Trump’s top trade negotiator said he’s concerned by the European Union’s follow-through on pledges to regulate American tech giants fairly, just days after Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the EU’s controversial content-moderation law.
title: Greer ‘Disappointed’ in EU Treatment of US Tech After Trade Deal

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations will no longer be providing paper towels in the restrooms at its headquarters — an estimated $100,000 a year in cost savings — in the latest statement on the funding woes at the world’s peacekeeping body.
title: Paper Towels Are Latest Victim of Serious UN Funding Woes

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Caitlin Reilly
description: Republican congressional leaders are considering a Medicare pay cut for hospitals as GOP lawmakers try to come up with a counterproposal to Democrats’ demands to renew Obamacare subsidies, House Majority Leader Steve Scalise said Wednesday.
title: Hospital Payments Targeted as GOP Grasps for Health Plan

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Europe has failed to provide sufficient military support to Ukraine to make up for the loss of US assistance since President Donald Trump returned to power this year, according to the latest data from the Kiel Institute.
title: European Aid to Ukraine Fails to Offset Loss of US, Study Shows

author: Fabiola Zerpa, Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela detained its top Catholic leader and confiscated his passport just as opposition figure María Corina Machado drew international attention for receiving the Nobel Peace Prize.
title: Venezuelan Archbishop’s Passport Seized as Machado Wins Nobel

author: Ilya Arkhipov
description: Russia has practically achieved its military recruitment targets for this year set out by President Vladimir Putin after more than 400,000 people signed contracts, according to the deputy chairman of the country’s Security Council.
title: Putin Ally Hails Military Army Drive to Meet Target

author: Ilya Arkhipov
description: Russia has practically achieved its military recruitment targets for this year set out by President Vladimir Putin after more than 400,000 people signed contracts, according to the deputy chairman of the country’s Security Council.
title: Putin Ally Medvedev Hails Russian Military Recruitment Drive to Meet 2026 Target

author: Allyson Versprille
description: The head of the US Federal Aviation Administration, Bryan Bedford, appears to have not divested stock in the airline he ran before joining the Trump administration, according to the top Democrat on the Senate committee overseeing the agency.
title: FAA Chief Appears to Still Hold Airline Stock, Cantwell Says

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland’s agreement last month to get the US to lower tariffs on the country will be backdated to take effect on the day the deal was announced.
title: Switzerland’s Improved 15% US Tariff Deal to Apply Retroactively

author: Kristina Peterson
description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said that a national food standard is “on the table for discussion.”
title: RFK Jr. Says National Food Standard on Table Amid State Activism

author: Ben Bartenstein
description: The US extended a sanctions waiver for some Lukoil PJSC transactions until next month as deal discussions over the sale of the firm’s foreign assets picked up.
title: Trump Team Extends Lukoil Sanctions Waiver as Deal Talks Pick Up

author: Alberto Nardelli, Alex Wickham
description: President Donald Trump held talks with British Prime Minister Keir Starmer, French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Friedrich Merz as the US pushes for a deal to end Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: Trump Holds Call With Starmer, Merz, Macron Over Ukraine Talks

author: Fred Ojambo
description: The US and Uganda have agreed on a $1.7 billion health financing, part of a program that seeks to wean African nations off aid.
title: US Agrees on $1.7 Billion Health Funding Package With Uganda

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Flavia Rotondi
description: Pope Leo XIV spoke out against US President Donald Trump’s recent broadsides against Europe, saying the comments risked upending a longstanding transatlantic alliance.
title: Trump Words Risk ‘Breaking Apart’ US-Europe Alliance, Pope Says

author: Eric Martin
description: Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Corina Machado secretly left Venezuela in a bid to get to Oslo in time to accept her award but was forced to miss the ceremony because bad weather delayed her journey, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: How Nobel Winner Machado Secretly Left Venezuela to Accept Prize

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: A federal judge in New York ordered grand jury materials from the sex trafficking probe of financier Jeffrey Epstein unsealed at the request of the US government.
title: Judge Says DOJ Can Release Epstein Grand Jury Materials

author: Aashna Shah
description: Kathryn Garcia, a top aide to New York Governor Kathy Hochul, has been nominated as executive director of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, the bi-state agency which runs the metro area’s air and seaports.
title: Hochul Picks Kathryn Garcia as Next Head of Port Authority

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: A federal judge said the Trump administration can’t deploy the California National Guard in Los Angeles and must relinquish control of the troops to Governor Gavin Newsom, the latest setback in the administration’s bid to use soldiers to respond to civilian protests.
title: Trump Cannot Deploy National Guard in Los Angeles, Judge Says

author: Sanne Wass
description: Denmark will compensate victims in a decades-long scandal in which thousands of Greenlandic girls and young women were fitted with birth control devices by Danish doctors, often without their consent or awareness.
title: Denmark to Pay Greenlandic Victims of Forced Birth Control

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Dozens of trucks lined up next to Lithuania’s parliament building on Wednesday in a protest calling on the government to help companies recover thousands of vehicles being held by neighboring Belarus.
title: Lithuanian Companies Protest Over Trucks Being Held in Belarus

author: Annmarie Hordern, Lisa Abramowicz, Kevin Crowley
description: Chevron Corp. is in discussions with the Trump administration about remaining in compliance with sanctions in Venezuela, emphasizing the benefits to the US of the company’s continued presence, Chief Executive Officer Mike Wirth said.
title: Chevron in Discussions With Trump Administration on Venezuela

author: Marton Eder
description: An Austrian court has definitively blocked a US extradition request against former gas tycoon Dmitry Firtash after more than a decade of court hearings that included a record €125 million ($145 million) bail payment.
title: Ukraine Tycoon Wins US Extradition Fight After €125 Million Bail

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Nearly 1 million New Yorkers are expected to lose health coverage as a result of President Donald Trump’s federal budget, a shift that will strain the city’s struggling public hospital system.
title: NY Warns 950,000 People to Lose Health Coverage Under Trump Cuts

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The Rwanda-backed M23 rebel group claimed it captured the strategic city of Uvira in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, less than a week after US President Donald Trump oversaw the signing of a peace deal between the two countries.
title: Rwanda-Backed Rebel Group Claims Capture of Key East Congo City

author: Shruti Srivastava
description: Officials from US and India on Wednesday kicked off two-day talks aimed at resolving differences and finalizing a trade deal, as New Delhi awaits relief from high tariffs imposed by Washington.
title: India, US Discuss Trade Deal as New Delhi Awaits Tariff Relief

author: James Woolcock
description: Keir Starmer said pursuing a customs union with the European Union isn’t a “sensible” way forward for Britain because it would jeopardize deals struck with the US and India.
title: Starmer Warns Rejoining EU Customs Union Would Unravel US Deal

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union’s executive branch is drafting sanctions targeting migrant smugglers and their funding, part of the bloc’s broader efforts to restrict illegal border crossings.
title: EU Preparing Sanctions on Migrant Smugglers, Von Der Leyen Says

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Dan Goldman is proud of his work taking on President Donald Trump — whether on immigration, Ukraine or the US Constitution. The Democratic congressman even led the first impeachment proceedings against Trump before winning election in 2022 to represent a wealthy, liberal New York City district.
title: NYC Democrats Fight for Congressional Seat Showing Israel Divide

author: Molly Smith
description: US data agencies need urgent help from the Trump administration and Congress to ensure they can carry out their basic duties and restore public confidence amid a deepening crisis, according to a new report by some of the country’s top statistics experts.
title: US Stats Agencies Need ‘Immediate’ Help to Do Their Job, Report Says

author: Michael Nienaber, Laura Alviz
description: Germany will buy up to 500 RCH 155 self-propelled howitzers as part of a historic effort to push through €52 billion ($60.5 billion) in defense orders before Christmas.
title: Germany to Procure Wheeled Howitzers Worth €3.4 Billion

author: Sanne Wass
description: A Danish intelligence agency has for the first time described the US as a potential security risk, signaling a shift in the Nordic country’s view of its close ally amid geopolitical frictions over Greenland.
title: Danish Spy Agency Now Views US as a Possible Security Concern

author: Faris Mokhtar, Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesia is resisting US trade-deal demands that it fears would restrain its independence, particularly in critical minerals and energy that risk its relations with China and Russia, according to people familiar with the situation.
title: Trump Team’s Demands on Mining, China Snarl Indonesia Trade Deal

author: Nasteho Said
description: Southeast Asia has emerged as a surprise beneficiary from global trade turmoil, with the region’s exports to the US growing at a faster pace than heavyweight rival China, according to a Lowy Institute analysis.
title: Southeast Asia Emerges as Surprise Winner in US-China Trade Spat

author: Zoe Schneeweiss, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland’s parliament elected Economy Minister Guy Parmelin as the country’s president for 2026, succeeding Finance Minister Karin Keller-Sutter.
title: Swiss Parliament Elects Economy Chief Parmelin as President

author: William Horobin
description: France’s efforts to adopt a budget could roll into next year as divisions remain among lawmakers and senators despite a breakthrough on the social security bill, the government said.
title: French Government Says Budget Talks Could Continue Into January

author: William Wilkes, Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Wingtech Technology Co. has invited court-appointed custodians of Nexperia BV to discussions in a bid to regain control of the Dutch chipmaker and resolve an impasse that has threatened supplies of critical components for automakers.
title: Wingtech Seeks to Restore Nexperia Control as Chip Feud Lingers

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey’s central bank is poised to cut interest rates again on Thursday, with policymakers encouraged by unexpectedly favorable inflation data.
title: Turkish Central Bank Taking Cautious Approach to Next Rate Cut

author: Alan Crawford
description: Governments around the world are closely observing the impact of the new measure targeting under-16s.
title: Australian Social-Media Ban Faces a Trump Test

author: Jacob Lorinc
description: The four decades that China spent building dominance in the small world of critical minerals is proving frustratingly hard to overcome.
title: Rare Earths Aren’t Rare for Everyone

author: Daniel Carvalho
description: Brazil’s lower house of Congress approved a bill that could reduce the amount of time former President Jair Bolsonaro spends in jail for plotting a coup, voting just days after his son declared his own candidacy in next year’s election.
title: Brazil Lawmakers Back Bill to Reduce Jair Bolsonaro’s Time in Prison

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Chile’s pension regulator is stepping up scrutiny of foreign interest rate derivatives held by the nation’s pension funds, trying to get more information on the value of contracts after their use soared.
title: Chile Regulator Fires Off Data Requests on Pension Fund Swaps

author: Kirsi Heikel
description: Finland needs to fine tune how it provides basic health-care services in the midst of deeper budget deficits, according to a report assessing an overhaul carried out two years ago.
title: Finland Needs More Reforms to Pay for Health Care, Report Says

author: Philip Aldrick, Joe Mayes
description: Rachel Reeves slammed “damaging” leaks ahead of her UK budget last month, and said they were unauthorized, as she sought to distance herself from a chaotic run-up to the Nov. 26 setpiece.
title: Reeves Says Damaging UK Budget Leaks ‘Clearly Not Authorized’

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungary’s ruling-party dominated parliament approved a bill that will make it harder for parliament to remove the country’s president from office.
title: Hungary Approves Law Making It Harder to Remove President

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. 

On today's show, Federal Reserve officials are primed to deliver a third consecutive interest rate cut later today.
Kevin Hassett, who is seen as the frontrunner to replace Chair Jerome Powell, believes there's room for the central bank to cut more than 25 basis points. Bloomberg has learned that SpaceX is moving ahead with plans for an IPO next year.

Sources say it aims to raise significantly more than 30 billion dollars, with the company seeking a valuation of about 1.5 trillion dollars. It would be the biggest IPO in history. And in a world first, Australians under 16 are now barred from accessing social media services like TikTok, Instagram and Facebook.

Today's guest: Carmen Palacios-Berraquero, Nu Quantum CEO (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fed Primed To Cut Again, SpaceX Plans Mega IPO | Daybreak Europe 12/10/2025

author: Ewa Krukowska, Zosia Wanat
description: Poland’s biggest defense holding, Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa SA, seeks to ramp up sales to European allies and tighten cooperation with heavyweights including Rheinmetall AG, Thales SA and BAE Systems Plc.
title: Poland Looks to Sell More Ukraine-Tested Military Gear to Allies

author: Jon Herskovitz
description: The US is proposing that foreign visitors provide their social media history over the last five years to enter the country, including those from Australia, Germany, Japan and the UK who can now enter without a visa.
title: US Plans to Mandate Social Media Checks for Visa-Free Visitors

author: Sakura Murakami, Alastair Gale
description: Japan and China remain locked in a blame game, with Japan complaining that China did not provide enough information on a Chinese military exercise that led to an alleged use of fire-control radar against Japanese fighter jets.
title: Japan and China Remain at Odds Over Radar Use as US Weighs In

author: James Mayger
description: Chinese and Russian warplanes flew around Japan’s southern islands, following a course taken days earlier by China’s first aircraft carrier, prompting Tokyo to scramble fighters amid rising military tensions.
title: Japan Scrambled Jets to Watch Chinese, Russian Bomber Formation

author: Kati Pohjanpalo, Stephen Treloar
description: The laureate of this year’s Nobel Peace Prize, María Corina Machado, has not arrived in Norway and won’t attend the award ceremony, Norwegian broadcaster NRK reported.
title: Nobel Peace Prize Winner Machado to Miss Oslo Ceremony, NRK Says

author: Rakesh Sharma, Sanjai P R
description: Four out of India’s seven largest refiners are now in the market for Russian crude as deep discounts push buyers to seek out non-sanctioned barrels, even as heavyweight Reliance Industries Ltd. stays away.
title: Large Indian Refiners Take Russian Oil as Reliance Avoids Trade

author: Viktoria Dendrinou
description: Greece is about to face the most symbolic test yet on its road to euro-area rehabilitation as its finance minister bids to run the same forum where the country’s debt crisis once played out.
title: Euro Job Race Offers Greece Chance for Symbolic Rehabilitation

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkey must no longer possess the Russian S-400 air defense system if it wants to return to the US-led program to manufacture and purchase F-35 jets, American envoy Tom Barrack said.
title: US Envoy Says Turkey Must Abandon Russian Missiles to Get F-35s

author: Jane Lanhee Lee
description: The US Department of Justice unveiled additional charges against a Ukrainian woman accused of supporting Russian state-backed cyberattacks against critical infrastructure.
title: US Slaps New Charges on Ukrainian Over Russian Cyberattacks

author: Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump said he had recently “aced” a third cognitive exam as he looked to bat down questions about his age and acuity.
title: Trump Says He ‘Aced’ a Third Cognitive Exam Taken Recently

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said he plans to reach out to the leaders of Thailand and Cambodia after border clashes flared up again, one of eight conflicts the US leader says he’s ended with tariff threats and his administration’s “peace through strength” policy.
title: Trump Says He’ll Call Thailand, Cambodia Over Renewed Conflict

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump suggested he could seek to oust Federal Reserve governors appointed by President Joe Biden if their commissions were signed by autopen, in his latest bid to exert control over the central bank.
title: Trump Floats Autopen Investigation Into Biden’s Fed Nominees

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Representative Dan Goldman (D-NY) states President Trump is gaslighting Americans & betraying his campaign promises by calling affordability a Democratic con job. Rep. Mark Alford (R-MO) discusses what he expects President Trump to talk about during the President's economic agenda speech in Pennsylvania. Senator Tina Smith (D-MN) discusses what next steps are for healthcare reform as the possibility both Democratic & Republican health care proposals may not have the votes to pass. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump to Tout Economic Agenda in Pennsylvania | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/09/2025

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump said people were “starting to learn” the benefits of his tariff regime as he sought to convince voters his administration was moving to address affordability concerns, taking to the road in hopes of countering a mounting political vulnerability.
title: Trump, Seeking Economic Reset, Insists Smart People Back Tariffs

author: Anna J Kaiser
description: Eileen Higgins won Miami’s mayoral runoff, beating a candidate backed by President Donald Trump while becoming the first woman ever and the first Democrat in nearly three decades to lead the city.
title: Democrat Wins Miami Mayoralty, Shaking Trump-Led State Dominance
